intro: Bidens grantii, commonly known as the golden tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and disturbed soils. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies. Bidens grantii is also known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
